content.description: Sit start at two crimp pinches on the gently overhanging face, climb up and right through more crimps to a right hand sloping pinch and a left hand edge just over the lip. Engage exciting top-out moves through a sloper and some more crimps on the slab. Be careful with the topout
content.location: In right-hand face on Jonah boulder, looking uphill. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start on large sloping jug with huge foot down low, just left of large tree. This is the same start as Fig Newtons. Traverse left on ledge around middle height of the boulder. Continue traversing into the start of Plankton, using ample heel hooks and toe hooks to taste, then top out same as Plankton, pulling up and mantling through topout a couple feet to the right of the tree
content.location: In right-hand face on Jonah boulder, looking uphill. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Sit start on obvious rail with low feet. Move up to solid crimps on the left side of the horizonal crack, slap for slopey lip. Move up to good jug for an easy top out.
content.location: On Jonah Boulder down hill from "The Dish" near the corner.

content.description: Start deep in cave on large flake. Move up flake to jug, the make huge right hand throw to sloping lip. It feels like a jug if you reach it! Get feet up on right, match on sloping lip, then move up through desperate jugs straight up into the "V". A bit mossy at the top, but the jugs are good.
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: This is the right exit of Dab Sit Sit. Sit start with the left hand on a little two finger half pad crimp, and a right hand just under it on a decent crimp. Smear and throw behind you to a large jug, set your feet and come into the giant sloper that is the beginning of Fuckin' Dabs. From here move up right to a finger jug. Do a big move out right to a wide sloping pinch, set a heel, and come into a perfect left hand block pinch on the lip. Move right to a crimp on the lip, get a heel, snag a sloping crimp and engage an exciting (dicey) mantle. Very cool.
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start on Plankton and traverse left, moving down and past the tree "threading the needle". Pull up onto jugs and top out through Humpback Whale
content.location: Located on Jonah Boulder, the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Sit start on giant jug in mid-right of the flat face. Move up through some crimps left, then get a solid 2 finger pocket with right, topping out the directly above the start, sharing a topout with Atlas Sharted
content.protection: On long face of Shartreuse boulder, the first boulder ~10 ft uphill of Flying Squirrel
content.location: 1 pad

content.description: Follows the same path as the easier Ground Squirrel Don't care and the harder Flying Squirrel. Sit start with both hands on the jug. Reach out to the arete out left (intermediary handholds off) and then to the obvious jug on the face. Continue to top out straight up, right side boulder and left side face both off.
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Boulder, a few hundred feet up the Cliff Trail (Yellow Blazes). There is a blaze on this boulder, it sits on the right of the trail as you walk up from the parking lot.

content.description: Start super lowball with hands on low left jug and feet up high to the right. Bump up to lip and work your way around corner to start of Atlas Sharted and top out there.
content.location: On downhill side of Shartreuse boulder, the first boulder ~10 ft uphill of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start on the big jug rail that shares the start with Nipple Twist Sit. Move up and left across the bulging face and finish on the large jug shelf with The Belly.

Start on large sloping jug about waist height on rightmost side of face. Get feet low, or throw a heel hook on the starting jug for extra style points! Move up through juggy rails left. Pull up and mantle through topout a couple feet to the right of the tree
content.location: On downhill face of Jonah Boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Traverse lip on right face perpendicular to trail. Start where the boulder meets the trail, traverse until you reach the slightly overhanging face, then top out.
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Boulder, a few hundred feet up the Cliff Trail (Yellow Blazes). There is a blaze on this boulder, it sits on the right of the trail as you walk up from the parking lot.

content.description: On leftmost side of face, just right of The Belly. Sit start on sloping crimps with huge left foot and decent right foot. Throw up right for angled finger jug rail, then move up through crimps to a sloping pinch on the right. Find jugs and topout
content.location: Located on left-hand face (looking uphill) of Jonah Boulder, directly on trail. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: In the center of the overhanging side of Jonah, crawl down into the depths and establish on an undercling crimp. Do a big throw to a decent finger jug and from here go out right to a small crimp (far). Crimp hard and climb up through a sloping jug to more jugs and a straight forward top out. RAD!
content.location: Located on the uphill face on Jonah Boulder, just left of Baron Harkonnen, looking downhill and the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on with left hand on the shallow crimp and right hand on the flakey crimp rail. Move up into a large jug on the left and follow through another jug to the big pinch horn on the block above. Topo image is in red overlayed on the original problem listed as Moral Relativity.
content.location: Jonah Boulder as you first approach from the trail.

content.description: Start standing on good edges to the right of General Relativity and left of Special Relativity.  Move up on edges, then right to a tricky lip encounter.
content.location: Jonah Boulder.

content.description:
Sit start just right of the giant wide sloper that begins Fig Newtons. With a left hand sidepull and a right hand crimp, move up to another crimp, set a foot on the giant blocky sloper to your left and fire for the lip then top out.

 Video beta: youtube.com/watch?v=iv0ufUi…
content.location: In right-hand face on Jonah boulder, looking uphill. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: This is on the right side of the Fanny Pack Boulder, looking uphill. Start low on the left side on slopers and traverse across the sloping lip close to the ground. Gain some jugs on the next section and then move right across the obvious smiling crack on slopers and good crimps. At the right side of the crack move up to the lip, snag a right hand undercling and engage an exciting top-out
content.location: On Fanny Pack Boulder, just uphill of Shartreuse

content.description: Stand start with right hand on a smooth crimp, left hand on a higher knob, feet on a slopey rail at around knee height. Climb straight up to the tallest point of the face. The arete is on.
content.location: This is on the Flying Squirrel boulder, which is the first boulder you'll see if you're approaching from the nearby parking lot. This is on the opposite face from the squirrel-themed dihedral, just to the right of a tree.

content.description: Start on downhill face, on left side of boulder between downclimb/trail marker on left and large tree. Sit start down low on large jug with great feet. Move up through jugs until you reach lip next to tree. Unlock crucial left foot beta to aid topout slapfest, flip right hand to a mantle and flop onto top. Careful not to dab on the tree!
content.location: Located on Jonah Boulder, the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Left exit of Vasectomy. When you reach sloping lip, move left along lip through crimps until you reach arête. Top out along arête, careful not to fall on the back breaker boulder just below you!
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Sit start on low jugs on left slightly overhanging face. Climb using selection of holds around arête and face, top out with feet on right side of boulder
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Boulder, a few hundred feet up the Cliff Trail (Yellow Blazes). There is a blaze on this boulder, it sits on the right of the trail as you walk up from the parking lot.

content.description: Start with both hands in the horizontal crack at chest height. Make a big move straight up to the lip, then top out.
content.location: On the Fanny Pack boulder, on the same face as Lego Harry Potter, on the opposite face as Fanny Pack Traverse.

content.description: To the right of Nipple Twist there is a bulging sloping roof half way up the boulder, sit start here. Bearing down on tiny crimps in a seam, defy gravity, and throw off a good right foot to a large finger bucket. Climb up through comfy crimps/jugs and get high feet until you can reach some crimpy crystals up and right. Top-out through good slopers and a jug in a crack.
content.location: Jonah Boulder

content.description: Start deep in cave on a large sloping shelf, to the right of Vasectomy. Throw up right to a good crimp watching the rock behind you, DON'T DAB. Go left to a smaller though still good crimp on the arete. Go straight up to the lip and top out through some more crimps and good holds.
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Sit start on low jugs on left slightly overhanging face. Same start as Ground Squirrel Don't Care. Dyno straight up past intermediate holds to the jug on the left side of the face about a foot from the top. Gain the lip and rock over the top, right side of boulder is off
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Boulder, a few hundred feet up the Cliff Trail (Yellow Blazes). There is a blaze on this boulder, it sits on the right of the trail as you walk up from the parking lot.

content.description: Start on large sloping jug with huge foot down low, just left of large tree. Make big move up right to a jug, then reposition and make long reach left for lip. Carefully move left past sloping lip to large flat section of lip. Double mantle for the topout! Top often collects leaves, so check it out first.
content.location: In right-hand face on Jonah boulder, looking uphill. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Looking uphill, start on left side, closest to Jonah Boulder. Start on sloping jug on downhill side and traverse lip around left. Top out once you get to the uphill face of the boulder
content.location: On Fanny Pack Boulder, just uphill of Shartreuse

content.description: Looking uphill, start on left side, closest to Jonah Boulder. Start on sloping jug on downhill side and traverse lip around left (same start as Fanny Pack Traverse). Halfway through the traverse, make big move up to lip and topout over third tier lip
content.location: On Fanny Pack Boulder, just uphill of Shartreuse

content.description: Start matched and seated on a good crimp rail to the right of General Relativity.  Make a hard move off the ground, then climb straight up the boulder on edges to a tricky lip encounter.
content.location: On the Jonah Boulder, to the right of General Relativity.  See picture.

content.description: Start as for The Dish, but climb right after the opening moves (following a right-trending seam) to an easier but dirtier lip encounter in front of the tree.
content.location: Jonah Boulder.

content.description: Same start as Vasectomy on large sharp jugs in cave. Move out left to a good side pull. Make a big move up and left to a huge jug. Situate your feet and make another huge move for the lip. Match hands and top out awkwardly through some juggy slopers/gastons. Total death landing but awesome problem!
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: This is a true sit start to Fuckin' Dabs. Sharing the same start as Time and Silence, sit start low with the left hand on a little two finger half pad crimp and a right hand just under it on a decent crimp. Smear and throw behind you to a large jug, set your feet and come into the giant sloper that is the beginning of Fuckin' Dabs. Originally done from the left hand two finger crimp and the right hand jug just under the large sloper, it was later realized that the first move to the jug was, in fact, possible. Thus it's a sit to the sit, a "sit sit." Very cool!
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: This is the left exit of Dab Sit Sit. Sit start with the left hand on a little two finger half pad crimp, and a right hand just under it on a decent crimp. Smear and throw behind you to a large jug, set your feet and come into the giant sloper that is the beginning of Fuckin' Dabs. Move up to the lip, then traverse left using heel hooks or campus burl. When you get to the farthest left side of the lip get a good jug and do a big move to an even bigger jug and top out. Shares a topout with Harpoon. PUMPY!
content.location: On uphill face of Jonah Boulder, in cave on the left, looking down at the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description:
It's a slab climb that starts on the same start as Nut Dragger and the same topout as Ground Squirrel Don't Care.

 The entire lip is off as well as the giant flat step on the ground about halfway through the traverse (marked in the photo). Traverse up using only the face of the wall parallel with the trail using some of the small edges, crimps, slopers, and an undercling at the beginning. Once the corner is reached, look up to use a crimpy rail on the perpendicular wall and top out up the middle right above that. Since the lip is still off, the main foot to top out is the big jug on the top left of the perpendicular wall.
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Boulder, a few hundred feet up the Cliff Trail (Yellow Blazes). There is a blaze on this boulder, it sits on the right of the trail as you walk up from the parking lot.

climbs.name: Brian's Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day

content.description: This is a left exit to Never Let Me Go. Start on the undercling, throw, match, and extend high and left to a full pad side-pull. From here either power straight up to the lip (jug, far) or go slightly right to a large sloper (closer, worse hold). Either way, gain a sloping right hand crimp just over the lip and mantle down to reach a giant right hand side-pull, toping out LEFT of the easier topout of Never Let Me Go.
content.location: Located on the uphill face on Jonah Boulder, just left of Baron Harkonnen, looking downhill and the boulder.

content.description: It is located on the overhanging corner of the boulder that has a cut down tree behind it. Sit start as low as possible on an undercling and crimps and climb out underneath the prow until you come to the lip. Either wrestle the long sloper out and right until you can get some good jugs to top out, or stay left and throw for a good crimp on the face toping out through the slab. Two sets of beta, same grade.
content.location: Located on uphill, left corner of Jonah Boulder, directly on trail. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start in the same place as The Belly, on the overhanging corner of the Jonah boulder that has a cut down tree behind it. Sit start on an undercling and decent hold just above it. Climb straight up, get high right hand in decent sidepull crack, stand up and top out through jugs like The Belly
content.location: Located on uphill, left corner of Jonah Boulder, directly on trail. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start as per Baron Harkonnen and do the first move to the sloper. Match the sloper and finish as for Belly Harkonen. Maybe a bit contrived but fun nonetheless. Felt about the same as Baron Harkonnen and more than a 2-move wonder.

Sit down start immediately to the left of The Belly on a decent sloping left hand crimp and a tiny right hand crimp. Situate your feet (tricky) and throw up to a big sloper out right, then catch a small sloping crimp out left. From here rage straight up to good pinches on the lip and top out through good slopers and a great gaston and jug slightly right. Allegedly "chill"
content.location: Located on the uphill face on Jonah Boulder, just left of The Belly, looking downhill and the boulder. Jonah Boulder is the largest boulder just uphill and left of Flying Squirrel

content.description: Start on large sloping jug on far left (downhill) side of flat face of boulder. Traverse up the lip and top out on jugs at highest point of boulder
content.location: On long face of Shartreuse boulder, the first boulder ~10 ft uphill of Flying Squirrel

content.description: The Cliff Trail is a steeper and longer trail to Cunningham Falls from the Hunting Creek Lake.  Numerous developed and undeveloped problems exist along the trail.
